cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic, then turning northwest mid-week toward the Carolinas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North or South Carolina (around Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coastline from Georgia northward through the Carolinas and into the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (39-57 mph) possible late Thursday into Friday with peak chance 27%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible if the track trends farther south, otherwise negligible
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals if outer rain shield reaches Georgia coast
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf throughout the week
